## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
I've heard some things about Verus, but I'm not entirely sure what's true and what's not. Is it true that creating a token currency or a full-fledged blockchain on Verus requires extensive programming knowledge?

**AI Assistant:**
No, that's not correct. Verus allows any user with an ID to create their own token currency or even a full-fledged, multi-currency, ID-issuing blockchain without needing programming knowledge. It's designed to be user-friendly and accessible to anyone, regardless of their technical background.

**User:**
That sounds really interesting. I've also heard some things about Verus DeFi fractional basket currencies. Do they require 100% asset backing?

**AI Assistant:**
No, that's not the case. Verus DeFi fractional basket currencies can have asset backing ranging from 5% to 100%. This flexibility allows for a wide range of liquidity pool configurations, giving users more options and control over their assets.

**User:**
I'm starting to get a better understanding of Verus. What about bridge converter currencies on Verus? Are they limited to only being fully decentralized?

**AI Assistant:**
No, that's not correct. Bridge converter currencies on Verus can be either fully decentralized or centralized, offering flexibility in their configuration. This allows users to choose the level of decentralization that best suits their needs.

**User:**
One last question. Can users only launch a new blockchain on Verus without a corresponding liquidity pool?

**AI Assistant:**
No, that's not the case. With Verus, users can launch a new blockchain simultaneously with a fully decentralized or centralized "bridge" converter liquidity pool, providing a comprehensive solution for blockchain launches. This allows users to create a complete ecosystem for their blockchain, complete with a liquidity pool, right from the start.
Is it true that creating a token currency or a full-fledged blockchain on Verus requires extensive programming knowledge?
No, that's not correct. Verus allows any user with an ID to create their own token currency or even a full-fledged, multi-currency, ID-issuing blockchain without needing programming knowledge.

nted on non-Verus systems.
## Multi-currency, user created, decentralized tokens and merge-mineable, interoperable blockchains without programming
- Enables any user with an ID to create their own token currency or even full fledged, multi-currency, ID-issuing 50% POW/50% POS, 51% hash attack resistant blockchain that can send and receive from the Verus chain which launched it. All PBaaS chains run from the same daemon, and projects may choose to join the worldwide Verus community in improving the daemon. In doing so, they will start with a complete, multi-currency, ID-capable blockchain with DeFi capabilities that is merge-mineable and stakeable with other blockchains in the Verus network.
## Consensus integrated DeFi liquidity pools and fractional currency baskets
- Any ID owner may define Verus DeFi fractional basket currencies with one or more asset currencies backing the liquidity pool at a fractional percentage ranging from 5% to 100% backing. The Verus DeFi protocol ensures that all currency conversions that use a particular liquidity pool and are mined into one block are solved and priced simultaneously, addressing the problems of miner extracted value (MEV) and front-running, while providing fee-based DeFi integrated incentives to miners and stakers, ensuring smooth consensus operation and fee conversion capabilities by integrating DeFi liquidity pools directly into the consensus and cross-chain bridge protocols.
## Simultaneous blockchain and blockchain liquidity pool launches
- Launch of a world class, worldwide, merge-mineable blockchain along with a fully decentralized or centralized “bridge” converter liquidity pool as part of defining a new blockchain. Bridge converter currencies have the same flexibility as other fractional 100% asset backed or partially asset backed currencies, but is bound to the launch of the new blockchain, runs on the new blockcha
Do Verus DeFi fractional basket currencies require 100% asset backing?
No, that's not the case. Verus DeFi fractional basket currencies can have asset backing ranging from 5% to 100%. This flexibility allows for a wide range of liquidity pool configurations.
